result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Hanson

records.addlTxt: A copy of the SENTENCING HEARING  transcript from 06-30-2014 by CYNTHIA A. DOBBS  filed in case 13CF5059.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (35 pages) commencing on 06-30-2014 SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant John J Hanson in court with attorney Jonathan A LaVoy.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant John J Hanson in court with attorney Jonathan A LaVoy.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties have reached a resolution and request a plea date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/30/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed. Deputy court clerk ccp.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy court clerk ccp.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed. Deputy court clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy court clerk ccp.
State's List of Witnesses received and filed. Deputy court clerk ccp.

Defendant John J Hanson in court with attorney Jonathan A LaVoy.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial and motion hearing. Court reviewed and heard arguments as to motions filed by the defense. Discussion regarding defense objection to the playing of the DVD of forensic interview at trial and motion to suppress. Parties will provide a copy of the interview to the Court. Court will review the tape and rule on the admissibility after hearing brief arguments at the motion hearing date. Arguments heard as to defense motion to withdraw as counsel. Court DENIED defense request for reasons placed on the record. Discussion regarding State's motion for dual juries. Defense does not object. Court GRANTS State's motion for dual juries. Defense counsel will be filing a request for court appointed expert funding. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/30/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Cover letter and Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
for Empaneling Dual Juries, received and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
State's motion to consolidate, argued.  Court grants the State's motion in part, and ordered this case consolidated with defendant's pending case, 13CF5059 for trial. 
Case adjourned for jury trial and final pretrial in Br 25.
Defendant to comply with all conditions of signature bond and Written No Contact Order.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KTM or co-actor Magdelena Montalvo.

Defendant John J Hanson in court with attorney Jonathan LaVoy.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Defendant advised that case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, due to lower pending case.  Defendant was given a copy of the complaint.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties.
Court appearance in Room 502 Safety Building on 2/11/14 @ 8:30am
